sect2.title: Introduction to nano
sect2.para: The nano package contains a small, simple text editor which aims to replace Pico, the default editor in the Pine package.

sect2.title: Installation of nano
sect2.para: Install nano by running the following commands:

userinput.command: ./configure --prefix=/usr --sysconfdir=/etc \ --enable-color --enable-multibuffer --enable-nanorc && make && make install && mkdir -p /usr/share/doc/nano/examples && cp nanorc.sample /usr/share/doc/nano/examples

sect3.title: Config files

screen.userinput: set autoindent set const set fill 72 set historylog set multibuffer set nohelp set regexp set smooth set suspend

sect3.para: Another example is in the /usr/share/doc/nano/examples directory in the nanorc.sample file. It includes color configurations and has some documentation included in the comments.
